statements: SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT user_id, username FROM users ORDER BY username DESC;
SELECT user_id, role FROM users WHERE user_id > 3 AND role = 'user';
SELECT user_id, username, role FROM users WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE role = 'Admin' ORDER BY user_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE username LIKE 'J%' AND role = 'User';
SELECT username FROM users WHERE user_id IN (1, 3, 5) AND role <> 'Admin';
SELECT DISTINCT role FROM users WHERE username LIKE '%son%' ORDER BY role ASC;

SELECT data_value FROM sensitive_data WHERE data_id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT user_id, username, role FROM users ORDER BY user_id DESC;
SELECT data_value, username FROM sensitive_data JOIN users ON sensitive_data.user_id = users.user_id;

SELECT user_id, username FROM users ORDER BY user_id DESC
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE role='admin'
SELECT project_name, user_id FROM projects WHERE project_id IN (1, 2, 3)
SELECT u.username, r.role_name FROM users u JOIN user_roles r ON u.role = r.role_name
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT username, role FROM users ORDER BY username ASC;
SELECT * FROM projects WHERE project_id > 100 ORDER BY project_name DESC;
SELECT users.*, user_roles.role_name FROM users INNER JOIN user_roles ON users.role = user_roles.role_name ORDER BY users.username;

SELECT projects.project_name, users.username, user_roles.* FROM projects LEFT JOIN users ON projects.user_id = users.user_id LEFT JOIN user_roles ON users.role = user_roles.role_name WHERE projects.project_id BETWEEN 50 AND 100 ORDER BY projects.project_name ASC, users.username DESC;

SELECT role FROM users WHERE username = 'john_doe';
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE user_id > 5;
SELECT * FROM roles;
SELECT view_name FROM views WHERE view_id = 3;
SELECT user_id, username, role FROM users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE username LIKE 'A%' ORDER BY role DESC;
SELECT * FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.user_id = user_roles.user_id WHERE role_id = 1;
SELECT user_id, username, role_name FROM users INNER JOIN roles ON users.role = roles.role_name;
SELECT DISTINCT role, count(*) AS total_users FROM users GROUP BY role HAVING count(*) > 1;
SELECT * FROM users ORDER BY id DESC;

SELECT role_name FROM roles WHERE id=2;
SELECT user_id, role_id FROM user_roles WHERE user_id=10;

SELECT id, username, role FROM users WHERE role = 'Admin';
SELECT username, role, id FROM users ORDER BY username DESC;
SELECT * FROM roles WHERE id = 3;
SELECT u.username, r.role_name FROM users u JOIN roles r ON u.role = r.role_name;
SELECT v.view_name, v.user_role, u.username FROM views v JOIN users u ON v.user_role = u.role WHERE u.username = 'John' ORDER BY v.view_name;
